userStories.title: Directory scanning for Git repositories
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the app to scan a configured directory for Git repositories so I can see all my projects in one place
acceptanceCriteria: Scans immediate subdirectories (depth 1) of configured root directory
Identifies projects by presence of .git directory
Skips non-Git directories

userStories.title: Projects directory configuration
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to configure the projects directory via settings screen and CLI flag so I can scan different workspaces
acceptanceCriteria: Settings screen allows changing scan directory with path validation
CLI flag --projects-dir <path> overrides config on launch
Configuration persists to ~/.projector.json

userStories.title: Basic Git status information
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see basic Git status for each project so I know which projects need attention
acceptanceCriteria: Display current branch name
Show uncommitted changes count (staged + unstaged)
Show unpushed commits count
Execute git commands with 5s timeout

userStories.title: Enhanced Git status with remote tracking
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see complete Git status including remote tracking so I can identify sync issues
acceptanceCriteria: Display unpulled commits count (behind remote)
Show last commit message (truncated to 60 chars)
Show last commit timestamp (relative format)
Display remote tracking status (up-to-date, ahead, behind, diverged, no remote)
Show last commit author

userStories.title: Visual Git status indicators
userStories.description: As a developer, I want visual indicators for Git status so I can quickly identify project states at a glance
acceptanceCriteria: Green checkmark for clean status
Yellow dot for dirty status (uncommitted changes)
Orange up arrow for unpushed commits
Blue down arrow for unpulled commits
Red warning icon for diverged branches

userStories.title: Language and framework detection
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see the language/framework for each project so I can quickly identify project types
acceptanceCriteria: Detect Node.js from package.json
Detect Go from go.mod
Detect Rust from Cargo.toml
Detect Python from pyproject.toml or requirements.txt
Detect Java from pom.xml or build.gradle
Detect Ruby from Gemfile
Detect C# from .csproj or .sln
First match wins when multiple files present

userStories.title: Project metadata display
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see project metadata so I can understand project characteristics
acceptanceCriteria: Display last modified timestamp (most recent file in project root)
Show project size in human-readable format (KB/MB/GB)
Calculate size efficiently without blocking UI

userStories.title: Projects list view
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a scrollable list of all projects so I can navigate my workspace
acceptanceCriteria: Display scrollable list with arrow key navigation
Each row shows: name, language icon, git status icons, branch, last commit
List updates incrementally as projects are scanned
Handle 50+ projects without performance degradation

userStories.title: Project detail view
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see detailed information for a selected project so I can understand its full status
acceptanceCriteria: Press Enter on project to open detail panel
Display full project path
Show all git status details from US-004
Display language/framework, last modified, and size
Show available actions
Press Esc to return to list view

userStories.title: Search and filter functionality
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to search and filter projects so I can quickly find specific projects
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle filter bar with / key
Fuzzy search by project name
Filter by language (e.g., /lang:go)
Filter by git status (e.g., /dirty, /unpushed)
Filter response time <100ms

userStories.title: Project grouping modes
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to group projects by different criteria so I can organize my workspace view
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle grouping with g key (cycles through modes)
Flat list mode (default)
Group by parent directory
Group by language
Group by git status (clean, dirty, unpushed, unpulled, diverged)

userStories.title: Open project in terminal
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to open a project in my terminal so I can quickly start working on it
acceptanceCriteria: Press o to open project in terminal
Spawn $SHELL in project directory
Support custom terminal command from config
Works on Linux and macOS

userStories.title: Open project in editor
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to open a project in my editor so I can quickly start coding
acceptanceCriteria: Press e to open project in editor
Spawn $EDITOR or configured command
Support custom editor command from config (e.g., 'code .')
Works on Linux and macOS

userStories.title: Command configuration
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to configure editor and terminal commands so I can use my preferred tools
acceptanceCriteria: Detect $EDITOR and $SHELL from environment
Allow override in config file under commands.editor and commands.terminal
Configuration persists across restarts
Settings screen provides UI for configuration

userStories.title: Manual refresh
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to manually refresh the project list so I can see latest changes
acceptanceCriteria: Press r key to trigger refresh
Show 'Scanning...' loading state during refresh
UI remains responsive during scan
Refresh completes in <3 seconds for 100 projects

userStories.title: Auto-refresh on focus
userStories.description: As a developer, I want the project list to auto-refresh when I return to the app so I always see current status
acceptanceCriteria: Detect terminal focus events when supported
Trigger refresh when TUI gains focus
Fallback to manual refresh if focus detection unsupported
Configurable via scan.autoRefreshOnFocus in config

userStories.title: Asynchronous project scanning
userStories.description: As a developer, I want projects to load asynchronously so the UI remains responsive during scanning
acceptanceCriteria: Display cached results immediately on startup (<500ms)
Scan in background using goroutine pool (max 10 concurrent)
Update UI incrementally as projects are discovered
Show spinner/progress indicator during scan
Full scan of 100 projects completes in <3 seconds

userStories.title: Project data caching
userStories.description: As a developer, I want project data to be cached so the app starts instantly
acceptanceCriteria: Cache scan results in memory (map[string]Project)
Persist cache to ~/.cache/projector/projects.json on exit
Load cache on startup for instant display
Cache invalidates on manual refresh

userStories.title: Configuration file schema
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a configuration file so I can customize app behavior
acceptanceCriteria: Config file at ~/.projector.json
Extends scaffold's existing config schema
Includes projector.projectsDir field
Includes projector.commands.editor and projector.commands.terminal
Includes projector.scan.autoRefreshOnFocus, concurrency, gitTimeout
Validates on load with helpful error messages

userStories.title: Debug logging for diagnostics
userStories.description: As a developer, I want debug logging so I can troubleshoot issues
acceptanceCriteria: Debug mode (--debug) logs scan duration per project
Log git command execution time
Log errors (missing remotes, detached HEAD, permission errors)
Logs written to debug.log without polluting TUI

userStories.title: Error handling for edge cases
userStories.description: As a developer, I want graceful error handling so the app doesn't crash on problematic repositories
acceptanceCriteria: Check git --version on startup, show error screen if missing
Timeout git commands at 5 seconds, show 'Timeout' status
Skip inaccessible directories due to permissions
Handle malformed Git repos without crashing
Log all errors to debug.log

userStories.title: Project data model implementation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a Project data model so I can represent all project information
acceptanceCriteria: Project struct with Name, Path, Language, Size, LastModified, Git fields
GitStatus struct with Branch, Remote, Uncommitted, Unpushed, Unpulled, LastCommitMsg, LastCommitTime, LastCommitAuthor, Status
StatusType enum: Clean, Dirty, Ahead, Behind, Diverged

userStories.title: Git operations module
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a Git operations module so I can query repository status
acceptanceCriteria: Execute git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD for branch name
Execute git status --porcelain for uncommitted changes
Execute git rev-list @{u}..HEAD --count for unpushed commits
Execute git rev-list HEAD..@{u} --count for unpulled commits
Execute git log -1 --format for last commit details
Execute git rev-parse --abbrev-ref @{u} for remote tracking branch
All commands timeout at 5 seconds

userStories.title: Settings screen extension
userStories.description: As a developer, I want projector-specific settings in the settings screen so I can configure the app via UI
acceptanceCriteria: Add Projects Directory field with path validation
Add Editor Command field (default: $EDITOR)
Add Terminal Command field (default: $SHELL)
Add Auto-refresh on focus toggle
Settings persist to config file

userStories.title: Performance benchmarking
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to verify performance targets are met so the app is responsive
acceptanceCriteria: Initial render with cached data <500ms
Full scan of 100 projects <3 seconds
UI frame time <16ms (60 FPS)
Filter operations <100ms response time
Scan of 50 projects <2 seconds
